title: Fertility rate in Brazil
yAxis: Number of children born per woman
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of children born per woman, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly negative which exists from 2013 to 2007.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2017 to 2016.
Differently, the next significant trend is extremely neutral which exists from 2016 to 2015.
Differently, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2015 to 2014.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is extremely neutral which exists from 2014 to 2013.
gold: This statistic shows the fertility rate in Brazil from 2007 to 2017 . The fertility rate is the average number of children born by one woman while being of child-bearing age . In 2017 , the fertility rate among Brazil 's population amounted to 1.74 children per woman .
